RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since March 28 Al lowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOCTOR ABBIE chased the early pace, then made a three wide bid on the turn and took over leaving the furlong marker and drew out to prove best under mild left handed crop urging. SHUTUP AND HANG ON was bumped into the first turn, then settled into stride three wide, advanced on the far turn and came five wide into the lane, lugged in leaving the three sixteenths and then finished willingly to be clearly second best. SPECTACULLARI was bumped and then checked in between rivals into the first turn, reserved early, then came three wide into the lane and was along for the show award late. GINGERS WISH was reserved early, moved up between rivals on the backstretch, then remained between rivals while advancing on the turn but flattened out the final furlong. DANCE A LITTLE JIG was settled back early, came widest into the lane and passed the tiring rivals. DWELLER set the early pace while clear, then ran off and opened up a big margin on the backstretch and then was headed leaving the turn and gave way the final furlong. TROPICALDEPRESSION drifted a bit into the first turn, then settled on the inside and weakened in the drive. HELLO GRACIE was four wide into the first turn, settled on the outside, came four wide into the drive and then was bumped by the three sixteenths and was empty. The jockey on SPECTACULLARI claimed foul against the number seven SHUTUP AND HANG ON for interference into the first turn, after the STEWARDS reviewed the replays the race was left as is.

ENTRY.NAME: Tropicaldepression
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted out first turn, setted inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Dweller
ENTRY.OWNER: Warriors Reward and Premier Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set unchallenged pace, ran off backstretch, gave way 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Dance a Little Jig
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, came widest upper stretch, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Gingers Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, between horses backstretch, flattened out 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Spectacullari
ENTRY.OWNER: McClay Thomas G Sweigart Dennis and Cullari Salvatore
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, checked first turn, reserved, came 3 wide, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Abbie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, bid 3 wide, drew out final 1/8, mild drive

ENTRY.NAME: Shutup and Hang On
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped first turn, advanced turn, came 5 wide, lugged in,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Hello Gracie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, settled outside, bumped 3/16, empty,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 78. Starter Allowance Purse 20000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE APRIL 28, 2022. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since March 28 Allow ed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARISTA VIXEN stalked the pace three wide and made a bid three wide when ready leaving the quarter pole, took over nearing the furlong marker and drew clear under mild crop urging. CUENCA dawdled along on the lead off the inside, then was headed nearing the furlong marker and could no go with the winner while staying on to be clearly second best, good effort. KATY THE CAT tracked the early pace two wide, between rivals on the turn and made a mild bid but could not sustain that bid, held show award. TERPEYE was allowed to settle early, came five wide into the lane and had no kick, missed show award. MIKEY'S JEWEL chased the pace on the inside and tired. FAVORITE DOLL chased the pace four wide and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Cuenca
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace off rail, dawdled along, headed 1/8, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Mikey's Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Terpeye
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 5 wide upper stretch, no rally,missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Katy the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, between horses 1/2, mild bid, faded,held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Favorite Doll
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Barista Vixen
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid when ready, drew clear, mild drive

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 75. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GET DOWN BROWN was away alertly to set the early pace, then drew clear on the turn and widened the margin in the drive to prove best under a drive. MIZZEN MONEY prompted the early pace three wide, then chased the winner on the turn and faded, held place award. FREEDOM'S START was allowed to settle early, shifted out on the turn, came seven wide into the lane and had a belated rally on the outside to just miss the place award. SUNSHINE JACK was well placed on the inside and weakened. JUMP FOR THE WIN chased the pace two wide and came three wide into the lane, angled out in the drive and faded. ECLIPTICALS BEAR chased the pace four wide, came five wide into the lane and was ermpty. ON THE RIM lacked a rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Sunshine Jack
ENTRY.OWNER: Tribe Dawg LLC and Kline Thomas
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, saved ground turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Get Down Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, drew clear turn, widened, driving,

ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, shifted out turn, came 7 wide, belatedly

ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Jump for the Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 2 wide, came 3 wide, angled out, steady fade

ENTRY.NAME: Eclipticals Bear
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, 4 wide turn, came 5 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Mizzen Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, chased 2 wide turn, faded, held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 28 Allow ed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLONEL BOWMAN stalked the early pace and made a three wide bid on the turn, shook clear off the turn and then widened the margin in the final furlong while being flagged left handed, ridden out. MARTINKELLY was well rated on the inside, eased out on the turn and came four wide into the lane and finished willingly to get the bob for the place award. DON'T LOSEMYMONEY set the pace on the inside and was two wide into the lane while dueling for command then faded, lost bob for the place award. PRACTICAL WAY chased the early pace and made a mild four wide bid on the turn, came five wide into the lane but flattened out. GRAB THE GOLD stalked the early pace in between rivals and then dropped back on the turn on the inside.

ENTRY.NAME: Martinkelly
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated inside, eased out turn, came 4 wide, got 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Losemymoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, 2 wide into lane, lost bob place

ENTRY.NAME: Practical Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, mild bid 4 wide, came 5 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Grab the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Bowman
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, drew clear, ridden out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 28. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LONGTAIL dueled for the lead on the inside and made a bid leaving the turn to shake clear by the furlong marker and then widened the margin the final furlong smartly to prove best, driving. C C'S WARRIOR dueled for the lead and made a three wide bid on the turn but could not keep pace with the winner in the lane, held place award. BEYOND THE BEND was off slowly, made a inside move on the turn but flattened out late, bested rest. WOLFINBARGER tracked the pace three wide, came four wide into the lane and weakened. DROSSELMOON tracked the pace four wide and came five wide into the lane and weakened. MR. SKITTLES passed the tiring rivals. COAST TO COAST chased the pace five wide and weakened. OBROTHER ITSYLVIA failed to menace.

ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, inside move turn, flattened out, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Longtail
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, bid upper stretch, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3 wide, bid 3 wide, no match, held 2nd

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 4 wide, came 5 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 5 wide, wide turn, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 28 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 All owed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIS NAME IS SUE set the pace in the two path, then was challenged off the turn by two rivals, turned back both bids and drew clear in the final furlong to prove best under a drive. CALCULATED THINKIN was well rated early four wide, made a four wide move on the turn to loom boldly off the turn, but hung the final furlong, won battled for place. I SEE THE STARS was well placed early on the inside, eased off the inside on the turn, made a three wide bid between rivals off the turn but hung late, missed place. SCREEN STAR chased the pace on the inside, waited on the turn and swung out five wide leaving the turn and had no kick. LEAVE 'EM LOADED lacked a rally. MAD GENIUS stalked the early pace three wide and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: I See the Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, eased out 1/4, bid between upper, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Screen Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, inside turn, swung out 5 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: His Name Is Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2 wide, turned back bids 1/8, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Mad Genius
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Calculated Thinkin
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 4 wide, bid 4 wide, hung, won battled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Leave 'Em Loaded
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SYNONYM chased the early pace four wide, angled in leaving the three eighths marker and made a inside move on the turn to take over, then drew off leaving the turn and was ridden out to prove much the best. QUINCY ADAMS was reserved early, came three wide into the lane, angled out nearing the sixteenth marker and rallied well, second best. ROUND ROBIN was settled early, made a inside move on the turn but flattened out late, bested rest. BARN SWALLOW pressed the pace four wide and then weakened in the lane. NEVER TOO MUCH was slammed hard by DANNY'S WINKSTER leaving the chute, then set a pressured pace in the two to three path while riding cautiously to avoid the loose horse, then weakened on the turn and stopped in the drive. DANNY'S WINKSTER veered in sharply bumping a rival and lost the rider leaving the chute, walked off once collared after the race. STEWARDS INQUIRY concerning the run out of the chute, after reviewing the replays the race was left as is.

ENTRY.NAME: Round Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside move turn, flattened out, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Quincy Adams
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 3 wide, angled out 1/16, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Never too Much
ENTRY.COMMENT: slammed chute, set pressured pace 2 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Synonym
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4 wide, angled in, inside move turn, drew off, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Danny's Winkster
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in chute, bumped rival, lost rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Barn Swallow
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 4 wide, weakened stretch,
